newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: BRITAIN'S CDC TO INCREASE SRI LANKA INVESTMENTS.
newsitem.headline: BRITAIN'S CDC TO INCREASE SRI LANKA INVESTMENTS.

text.p: Britain's overseas development finance institution Commonwealth Development Corp (CDC) said on Thursday it will sign an agreement with the Sri Lankan government to increase its investments in the Indian Ocean island.

"CDC has been investing in Sri Lanka since 1984 and has developed several excellent businesses. This agreement will facilitate increased levels of activity in Sri Lanka, an increasingly important country for CDC," the statement said.
It did not give details but said the emphasis was likely to be on infrastructure and industrial projects.

Some of the projects being considered by CDC include South Asia Gateway Terminals, which will expand Colombo's Queen Elizabeth Quay's annual container handling capacity to one million TEUs from the current 230,000, the statement said.
It said the CDC was also looking at investing in Lanka Bell, a company launched recently to provide basic telephone services in Sri Lanka.
CDC already has investments in Sri Lanka's plantation, power, finance and tourism industries.
